author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request met all of the guidelines for auto-merging and is scheduled to be merged when the mandatory waiting period (3 days) has elapsed.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment. You can edit blocking comments, adding `[noblock]` to them in order to unblock auto-merging.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

Nice package! :)

The name "MotivationalQuotes" would be more appropriate in my opinion. I think the word "Quotes" is much more closely tied to the package's functionality than the word "Me". Plus, I think the scope and purpose of the package are immediately clear from the name "MotivationalQuotes" while they are not as clear for "MotivateMe" (my initial guess based on the name MotivateMe, before reading the docs was that it had some sort of more technical approach to motivation).

[noblock]
Thanks! Nice idea. I kinda like your naming suggestion and because of that I will go through the hassle of renaming and registering everything again before it's too late :-)

title: New package: MotivateMe v0.1.0
